title: The hills of home,
author: Watt, Lauchlan McLean.
snippet: The little village of Wester How- gate, in touch with the range, has an affectionate  place in human memory through the exquisitely written tale, by Doctor John Brown, of Rab and His Friends.

title: Sheila /
author: Swan, Annie S.
snippet: And there's big Sandy Maclean an' a' his folks, and wee Sandy Maclean down by at Wester Coila, an* a heap more whose names I canna mind.'

title: The Scottish cavalier;

title: Traditions of Edinburgh.
author: Chambers, Robert
snippet: Thus she spent the ensuing day, and when it was night, she was taken out and remounted in the same fashion as before ; and the party then rode along" thi'ough the Torwood, and so to the place called Wester Polmaise, belonging to a gentleman of the name of Stewart, whose steward or factor was one of the cavalcade.

title: Reminiscences of Yarrow. Edited and annotated by ... Professor Veitch, LL.D. Illustrated by Tom Scott ... Second edition

snippet: And Wester therelike a stuck pig, feared to loose the horse, and a-f umblingin all his pockets.

title: Kriegspiel: the War-Game. [A novel.]

snippet: So he comes to theford, and the horse stumbles over the sack, was werynigh down (I meant it to save his knees), but Westergrips hold of the reins, and me whips my lord from hissaddle.

snippet: Three weeks we bided there, and neverstirred out but till nightfall; and Wester was wantin'to chuck the whole job up."

snippet: So I waited, and long and by last yousent word as the time was up; and me and Westertravelled by the train to Woodbridge, and walked when'twas dark to the mill.
